Issues.Title: fix(ivy): "select" attribute on <ng-content> should not be case-sensitive (FW-789)
Issues.Body:
While generating attributes for `projection` instruction, we checked whether attribute name is equal to 'select' in lower case. However in other places we treat 'select' attribute name as case-insensitive. This PR makes 'select' attribute consistently case-insensitive.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): setting up animation properties correctly (FW-643)
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change, animation properties were defined as element attributes, which caused errors at runtime. Now all animation-related attributes are defined as element properties.

Also as a part of this update, we start to account for bindings used in animations, which was previously missing.

Note: the `data.animations` was changed to `data.animation`, since this name is expected in [createRenderer function](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/platform-browser/animations/src/animation_renderer.ts#L43) - that seems like a typo.

P.S.: resolving this issue revealed 3 other issues. I did preliminary investigation, created tickets and mentioned them in `animation_renderer_spec.ts`.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: angular-bot should add "merge" label, when "merge-assistance" label is added
Issues.Body:
currently if anyone adds "PR action: merge-assistance" label to a PR and forget to add also "PR action: merge" label, the caretaker often misses these PRs because they filter only by the latter label and github doesn't support OR operator for queries.

to fix this common problem, the robot should automatically add the "PR action: merge" label if "PR action: merge-assistance" label was added but "PR action: merge" label is missing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "angular-bot should add "merge" label, when "merge-assistance" label is added" (#27494)

Issues.Title: feat(docs-infra): add option to cache all docs (e.g. for offline access)
Issues.Body:
We are currently able to persistently [cache via the SW][1] any doc (guide, tutorial, API page, etc.) that a user visits.
We could utilize that to provide an option to cache all docs eagerly (so that they are available offline, load faster on first visit, etc.).

Currently it is possible to hack your way there by manually running [this code][2] (e.g. via DevTools or as a bookmarklet).

##
**Possible options:**
- A button "hidden" somewhere (e.g. in the footer).
- A separate page with some (minimal or not so minimal) UI and explanation of the implications.

##
**Considerations:**
- How to handle errors. E.g.:
  * Sometimes some file requests randomly fail. (Re-download? Just log?)
- There is currently no reliable way to undo this. Once all files are cached, they will continue to be re-fetched and cached every time there is a change.
   (Fortunately, only the files that _did_ change are fetched.)

[1]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/8973dd5a7e6ede6d29a98684255088afac294a81/aio/ngsw-config.json#L60-L70
[2]: https://twitter.com/gkalpakas/status/1065929759593562113
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(docs-infra): add option to cache all docs (e.g. for offline access)" (#27492)

Issues.Title: feat(service-worker): minify SW script (+ sourcemaps)
Issues.Body:
Currently, the [SW script][1] generated by `@angular/service-worker` is unminified. This was intentional so that it was easier to debug and the stack traces (that people having issues might provide) would be easier to interpret.

Now that the SW is more stable, it may make sense to minify it for production (with sourcemaps for debugging).

[1]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/8973dd5a7e6ede6d29a98684255088afac294a81/packages/service-worker/BUILD.bazel#L29-L36
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(service-worker): minify SW script (+ sourcemaps)" (#27490)

Issues.Title: WIP: fix(ivy): align NgModuleRef implementation between Ivy and ViewEngine
Issues.Body:
Between Ivy and the View Engine, there are some discrepancies in the implementation of `NgModuleRef` which are causing 4 tests to fail in the router.
Currently in the View Engine:
1) `NgModuleRef` is an `Injector`
2) `NgModuleRef` has a public parent property named `_public`
3) `NgModuleRef` has a dependency on `CodegenComponentFactoryResolver` which basically produces `ComponentFactory` which are bound to a module
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "WIP: fix(ivy): align NgModuleRef implementation between Ivy and ViewEngine" (#27482)

Issues.Title: Feature: Injectable decorator handling multi-provider tokens
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/core

### Description
I would like to use the `@Injectable()` decorator to provide injectables for multi-provider tokens directly, instead of configuring them in a module. 

### Describe the solution you'd like
I assume the result is going to look something like this:
```typescript
@Injectable({
  providedIn: 'multi-token',
  attachedTo: HTTP_INTERCEPTORS,
  attachedAfter: [
    AuthenticationInterceptor,
    AuthorizationInterceptor
  ]
})
export class ErrorInterceptor implements HttpInterceptor {
// ...
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered
The current way works fine, although implementing this would probably help to get people to adopt the fancy, new `@Injectable({providedIn: ...})` syntax faster.

Also, I'm not sure about the `attachedAfter` part. Interceptor sequence ordering matters, but there probably are better solutions to that detail than I am suggesting here.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature: Injectable decorator handling multi-provider tokens" (#27477)

import { Rule, SchematicContext, SchematicsException, Tree } from "@angular-devkit/schematics";

export default function(): Rule {
  return (tree: Tree, context: SchematicContext) => {
    context.logger.warn("it's happening!");

    const pkgPath = "/package.json";
    const buffer = tree.read(pkgPath);
    if (buffer == null) {
      throw new SchematicsException("Could not read package.json");
    }
    const content = buffer.toString();
    const pkg = JSON.parse(content);

    if (pkg === null || typeof pkg !== "object" || Array.isArray(pkg)) {
      throw new SchematicsException("Error reading package.json");
    }

    if (!pkg.dependencies) {
      pkg.dependencies = {};
    }

    if (pkg.dependencies["@solarwinds/nav-menu-with-migration"]) {
      pkg.dependencies["ngx-perfect-scrollbar"] = `^7.0.0`;
      pkg.dependencies["ngx-device-detector"] = null;

      tree.overwrite(pkgPath, JSON.stringify(pkg, null, 2));
    }

    return tree;
  };
}

### Desired functionality/Repro/other details that might be useful
I would like to be able to follow the testing guide when using the new angular 7:
https://angular.io/guide/testing#configure-cli-for-ci-testing-in-chrome

But similar to as mentioned in now closed issue #11582 these docs on testing at angular.io still mention/instruct the public to use the `--browser option` instead of the new `--browsers`. And also the --single-run option, which I understand should now be `--watch=false`

So this instruction:
>`ng test --single-run --no-progress --browser=ChromeHeadlessCI`

Should now be:
>`ng test --watch=false --no-progress --browsers=ChromeHeadlessCI`

The next line in the docs source mentions also returns two now missing cli options in the current ng cli 7.0.7 that I'm using:
>`ng e2e --no-progress --config=protractor-ci.conf.js`

returns:
`Unknown option: '--no-progress'`
`Unknown option: '--config'`

Can you fix the docs or the CLI to be consistent. And as workaround perhaps specify alternative for the last two options of `ng test`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ng test options mentioned in testing docs don't work" (#13137)

export enum ErrorCode {

Closes #13102

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): fix #12886, import zone related flags in other file.
Issues.Body:
fix #12886.

all zone related `flags` now in `polyfills.ts`, which will not work properly, because `webpack` will put `import 'zone.js/dist/zone'` before `setting those flags`, which will make those `flags useless`.

So in this PR, I created a standalone file `zone-flags.ts` to keep the `import` in correct order.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): fix #12886, import zone related flags in other file." (#13132)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): code coverage for ng build, ng serve and ng e2e
Issues.Body:
This PR is related to #6286 and allows `--code-coverage` and `--code-coverage-exclude` options to be used with `ng build`, `ng serve` and `ng e2e`, so that it is easy to instrument the code for coverage.

When used with these commands, the `--code-coverage` switch does not automatically create a file with the report but allows the developers to access the `__coverage__` variable from Istanbul.js inside the browser to get coverage data.
That object can then be used to generate a report as described in https://istanbul.js.org/docs/advanced/coverage-object-report/
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): code coverage for ng build, ng serve and ng e2e" (#13131)

Issues.Title: Enable fine grain optimization settings
Issues.Body:
While doing the sourceMaps and optimisations flags, there were several places that had duplicate logic, and options were not really type safety as in most cases a castings was used.

This tried to improve how we normalize options and also improves type safety or at least it unifies the logic into a common method.

We can now enabled/disabled optimisations for scripts and styles.

Ex: 
```
 optimization: {
   scripts: true,
   styles: false,
 },
```

Following a suggestion from @filipesilva, I combined these 2 PRs togather.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Enable fine grain optimization settings" (#13120)

### Repro steps

- `ng build --prod --noAot --noBuildOptimizer`


### The log given by the failure
At the moment, when AOT is disabled components styles are not being optimised. Ie, cleancss is not running.

So for instance the above code, it should have been minified to `p {color: #fff}`. But this is only happening when using the AOT compiler.

### Desired functionality
Component styles should be minified both when using the JIT and AOT Compiler.

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): set `optimization` and `sourceMap` in universal production config
Issues.Body:
- When using Universal sourceMaps should not be enabled or at least `styles` sourceMaps should be disabled as these will otherwise be inlined and will be set as apart of the server side rendered page.

- While there is no benefit to optimize the scripts at server level, styles should always be minified so that the server side rendered page is smaller.

Fixes #12541 and Fixes #12940

Depends on https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/13116
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): set `optimization` and `sourceMap` in universal production config" (#13117)

Issues.Title: [Table] Cell view not updating when column definition is changed with trackBy set
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Cell view should be updated

#### What is the current behavior?
Cell view remains the same even though the underlying value is updated

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-wihjxb?file=app%2Ftable-basic-example.ts

Click on 'test' button
See that the first item name is not updated to 'TEST'

If this.columns reassignment is removed, then it works as expected

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular/Material 7.1.1

#### Is there anything else we should know?
If there's no trackBy function, then it works, because the item is getting removed and recreated again.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Table] Cell view not updating when column definition is changed with trackBy set" (#14394)

Issues.Title: [Chips] Selectable=false not working for keyboard input.
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Setting "[selectable]=false" on a mat-chip-list causes the chip to not be selectable via either the mouse or keyboard.

#### What is the current behavior?
Currently, selectable=false does disable mouse changes, but not keyboard changes.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Modifying the default mat-chip-list on the default chips stackblitz to be non-selectable ([selectable]="false") reproduces this behaviour.

https://stackblitz.com/angular/rokobmedblr?file=app%2Fchips-overview-example.html 

Add the selectable attribute, and then use the keyboard to focus on a non-selected (grey) chip and press spacebar.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
The stackblitz build says 7.1.1, and I was able to repro this on Chrome Linux and ChromeOS.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Chips] Selectable=false not working for keyboard input." (#14397)

Issues.Title: build: fix failing nightly snapshot tests
Issues.Body:
Apparently Yarn installs mismatching dependencies of Angular Github snapshot packages. Meaning that we need to flatten out all dependencies for `@angular/*` packages.

This can be achieved by using the Yarn's `resolutions` feature.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: fix failing nightly snapshot tests" (#14395)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): error on touch end
Issues.Body:
Fixes an error being thrown by `CdkDrag` when the `touchend` event fires.

Fixes #14390.

Marking as P2 since this will throw consistently on touch devices.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(drag-drop): error on touch end" (#14392)

Issues.Title: cdkDropList broken on touch devices on touchend
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
cdkDropList does not error

#### What is the current behavior?
The _cleanupDragArtifacts method now calls _getPointerPositionOnPage which does not handle touchend events correctly:
`const point = this._isTouchEvent(event) ? event.touches[0] : event;` 
 ==> When the event is "touchend" the event.touches array is empty. Instead changedTouches has the Touch object you need.
Documentation for the touches array (key portion "touch points that are currently in contact"):
A TouchList listing all the Touch objects for touch points that are currently in contact with the touch surface, regardless of whether or not they've changed or what their target element was at touchstart time.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
I don't think this is available as an npm yet, so I can't get a stackblitz.


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
I believe this was caused by https://github.com/angular/material2/pull/14140 and affects all touch-based browsers

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "cdkDropList broken on touch devices on touchend" (#14390)

Issues.Title: fix(badge): aria-label not being updated if description changes
Issues.Body: When we create a new badge element, we set its `aria-label` to the description of the badge, however that `aria-label` doesn't update if the description changes. These changes update the label accordingly.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(badge): aria-label not being updated if description changes" (#14393)

Issues.Title: Material Tabs with lazy loading rendering every time it's active
Issues.Body:
Bug, feature request, or proposal :

Material tabs (with matTabContent) are rendering  every time it's active (clicking on it ).

What is the expected behavior?

rendrer the first time it's activated only .

 What is the current behavior?

rendering each time we click on it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Material Tabs with lazy loading rendering every time it's active" (#14386)

Issues.Title: build: no longer require updating multiple package.json files for bazel
Issues.Body:
* Replaces second "package.json" file with a small workspace that just aliases to the actual dependencies provided in the "@matdeps" workspace. This speeds up the analysis phase and also makes debugging easier.
* Also proxies the "ng_package" so that it always includes the proper `README.md` file. Also this means that we can always replace the version placeholders. Similar to `angular/angular`.

Similar to https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/68074df0a23f12b11bd480a1911d7403d2b31530. Credits to @gregmagolan for this.

We just need a bit more work because we don't overwrite the default `compiler`, `xi18n` and `packager` targets to the actual source files (this is special to Angular because those contain the sources)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: no longer require updating multiple package.json files for bazel" (#14391)

Issues.Title: fix(menu): reduce specificity of icon selector
Issues.Body: In #14161 we had to tweak the selector for an icon inside a `mat-menu-item`, in order to fix an issue, however the new selector's specificity is a lot higher which can break people's overrides. These changes rework the approach to have a lower specificity selector.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(menu): reduce specificity of icon selector" (#14389)

Issues.Title: No outlines for checkbox, radio buttons when using TalkBack
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
When using Android TalkBack, the system highlights interactive elements with a green border when they are focused. On some components, such as mat-select, are highlighted as expected. However, mat-checkbox and mat-radio-button seem to be suppressing the highlighting.
It may be due to "-webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent", introduced in https://github.com/angular/material2/pull/11349.

#### What is the expected behavior?
mat-checkbox and mat-radio-button should be highlighted when they are focused by the screen reader.

#### What is the current behavior?
mat-checkbox and mat-radio-button are not highlighted when they are focused by the screen reader.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Go to https://material.angular.io/components/checkbox/overview on an Android phone with TalkBack enabled. Swipe horizontally until the attention is focused on the checkbox. You will see hear that that checkbox is focused and can be interacted with, but it is not highlighted on the screen.


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?


#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "No outlines for checkbox, radio buttons when using TalkBack" (#14385)

Issues.Title: feat(expansion-panel): add injection token for configuring the default options
Issues.Body:
Adds a new injection token to allow people to configure the default options for the expansion panel component.

Fixes #14383.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(expansion-panel): add injection token for configuring the default options" (#14384)

Issues.Title: Feature request: Default option values for Expansion Panel Header collapsed/expanded heights
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Possibility to control globally the `collapsedHeight` and `expandedHeight` properties of an Expansion Panel Header.

#### What is the expected behavior?
Similarly to what is currently available for form fields (via `MAT_FORM_FIELD_DEFAULT_OPTIONS`), if the `mat-expansion-panel-header`  `collapsedHeight` and `expandedHeight` properties are available for a global definition (default options), they should be considered for any Expansion Panel Header on the application.
If an Expansion Panel Header explicitly defines any of these properties, then the default values should be overriden.

#### What is the current behavior?
Not available as of now. Each `mat-expansion-panel-header` needs to explicitly declare these properties.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
N/A

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
When the Angular Material default values for `collapsedHeight` and `expandedHeight` don't meet the application needs, there should be a way to redefine them, reuse them, and consider their values from a global perspective.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Any.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature request: Default option values for Expansion Panel Header collapsed/expanded heights" (#14383)

Issues.Title: Mat Tab Group not working as expected inside Mat Menu
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Mat Tab Group does not autoselect its first tab by default when the mat tab group is located inside a mat menu.

#### What is the expected behavior?

Issues.Title: Feature Request: matFormField appearance="fill" has no way to control the background color.
Issues.Body:
I am enjoying the new additions to mat-form-field but I am unable to use them in my project because the background color of the input is too hard to select. I've tried all manner of css selectors and between inline styling, I have yet to find a way to change the background-color or any documentation stating how the theme it. I am aware that input allows for the underline, and the label, but in this case, there is no way to change the fillColor. I propose maybe something like 

```
<mat-form-field appearance="fill>
<input matInput name="name" fillColor="accent"> 
</mat-form-field>
```

or
```
<mat-form-field appearance="fill" fillColor="accent">
<input matInput name="name>
</mat-form-field>
```

This change will greatly improve the versatility of matInput, and allow for matInput to be used in a variety of applications!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature Request: matFormField appearance="fill" has no way to control the background color." (#14381)

Issues.Title: Snackbar and dialog taking full screen in production
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
I use MatDialog and MatSnackBar at various points in my web app to notify/ warn user about something. When I use these in debug mode using `ng serve` the size and position of snackbar is correct like snackbar is at the bottom of the page with height approximately 50-60px and dialog is at center of page with height enough to wrap the content. Now the problem what is occuring is when I am using `ng build --prod --build-optimizer` and uploading files to firebase hosting these same dialogs and snackbars are taking full height and full width.

#### What is the expected behavior?
The dialogs and snackbars should show normal behaviour in production mode

#### What is the current behavior?
Dialogs and snackbars cover whole screen in production mode

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Nice UI for the user

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
```
  "@angular/animations": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/cdk": "^7.0.2",
    "@angular/common": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/compiler": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/core": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/fire": "^5.1.0",
    "@angular/forms": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/http": "^7.0.1",

```

Issues.Title: Angular Material Getting Started should mention ng add as primary installation option
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Today I went with a beginner in Angular over adding Material Design and she started running the installation manually as she read in the [getting started](https://material.angular.io/guide/getting-started) guide. I think it makes most sense to have the first step in Getting Started being the `ng add` option. #### What is the expected behavior? Developers should be advised to use `ng add @angular/material`. #### What is the current behavior? Developers are currently advised to manually install the dependencies, then the snapshots, and after that the `ng add` option. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? It should be as easy as possible for people starting with Angular to add Angular Material. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? #### Is there anything else we should know? I would love to make the changes to the docs if the maintainers agree it should be addressed. Basically creating this issue to spark a conversation around it, if you agree I'll submit a PR üëç
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Material Getting Started should mention ng add as primary installation option" (#14380)

Issues.Title: Add (invisible) close button to datepicker overlay
Issues.Body: The datepicker presents itself as a modal dialog. On mobile devices, scree-reader users don't have an escape button to press and obviously would have a hard time tapping on the backdrop. We can add a close button with `cdk-visually-hidden` to help work around this. The label for this would also have to be added to `MatDatepickerIntl`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add (invisible) close button to datepicker overlay" (#14379)

Issues.Title: Rename MatTableDataSource to ClientArrayTableDataSource
Issues.Body:
I see too frequently people misunderstand the intent behind `MatTableDataSource`, thinking that it's meant to be the primary (or only) way to add data to the table. Renaming this, and more eminently presenting it in the docs as just one option would hopefully help clear this up. 

Obviously this will need to be done in a backwards compatible way. It will also need a migration schematic.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Rename MatTableDataSource to ClientArrayTableDataSource" (#14378)

Issues.Title: MatDialog scroll entire dialog
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: feature request #### What is the expected behavior? An ability to scroll the entire dialog and not just the content. Meaning - the dialog should have the full height of its content and scrolling will happen "outside" the dialog. The dialog would expand beyond the boundaries of the view. #### What is the current behavior? Scrolling can only happen inside the dialog. This creates a confusing UX where users don't have an indication that there is more content under scroll. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? #### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatDialog scroll entire dialog" (#14377)

Issues.Title: table[mat-table] doesn't allow debugElement.query to find directives inside it
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug: `table[mat-table]` makes testing hard because it doesn't have a way for getting `debugElement`s to be queried.

#### What is the expected behavior?
`fixture.debugElement.query(By.css('*'))` should find directives inside a mat-table

#### What is the current behavior?
`fixture.debugElement.query(By.css('*'))` only finds `table[mat-table]` as a DebugElement but it can't find any other debug element that's a child of the table

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-testing-template-4n6yno
This has 2 describes: 1 with `table[mat-table]` (normal table) and another with `mat-table` (flex tables)

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Testing is hard otherwise, my work around has been overriding the module, remove the directive, make a fake directive that has `@HostBinding('click') click() { capturedInstance = this; }` and test with that.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
6.0.0

#### Is there anything else we should know?
As implicitly mentioned above, `<mat-table>` works OK, the problem seems to be on how `<table mat-table>` renders the rows which seems to be with `createEmbeddedView`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "table[mat-table] doesn't allow debugElement.query to find directives inside it" (#14375)
